law.catch_line: USE OF FLAGMEN; CHANNELIZATION OF TRAFFIC.

structure.unit: ARTICLE L. - SIGNING AND TRAFFIC ROUTING IN THE EVENT OF STREET OBSTRUCTION

section.text: Provide signs and barricades and one (1) or more flagmen, as necessary to maintain traffic flow by the obstruction; or

Clearly and safely separate and channelize the opposing movement of traffic when the unobstructed portion of the roadway is of sufficient width to provide at least a ten (10) feet minimum lane. Such separation and channelization shall be achieved by the use of traffic cones, signs and/or barricades.
Failure to comply with the provisions of this section shall be a misdemeanor. (Code 1959 , §19-35; Ord. No. 1980-416, §4, 7-15-80; Ord. No. 1994-393, §§5, 6, 5-3-94)
